episode_title: 313 - The One Where Monica and Richard Are Friends

content.description: A Video Store, Monica is running in to return a video.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.
(The clerk enters the video into the computer.)

content.speaker: Clerk
content.text: Six dollars, please.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Six? I just had it for one night. It’s three.

content.speaker: Clerk
content.text: Eight o’clock is the cut-off and, (looks at his watch) aww, it’s 8:02.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know in a weird way, you have too much power. Look, you’re gonna have to help me out here, ‘cause I only have three.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I can help with that.
content.parenthetical: standing behind her, without his moustache

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God. Richard? (turns around) Hi!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! Your lip went bald. (Richard pays the clerk) Hey, thanks.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: So, you look great.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: No you do. You… just…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: You’ve got panties stuck to your leg.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s because I-I was just grabbing some things out of the dryer, and it’s static cling. Or maybe it’s just that God knew I’d be running into you and saw an opportunity.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: It’s good to see you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s good to see you too.
(They hug, and Richard notices a stocking stuck to Monica’s back, which he removes for her.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You see that guy? He’s in classics now, but y’know as soon as we leave he’s going straight to the porn.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: He’s gonna go up to the counter with Citizen Kane , Vertigo , and Clockwork Orgy. (they both laugh) This is nice.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I missed this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Me too.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: So, you wanna get a hamburger or something?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, um, I don’t know if that’s a good idea.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh. Look, just friends, I won’t grope you. I promise.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, I just I think that it’s too soon.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: No it’s not too soon, I had lunch at a eleven.

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler, Ross. Joey, and Rachel are eating breakfast. Chandler is holding a bottle of Hersey’s Syrup.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, baby!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Making chocolate milk. Do you want some?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No thanks. I’m 29.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, I gotta go to work!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh sweetie, when do you think you’re going to get off tonight?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh I don’t know honey. It’s gonna be really late.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh come on, not again.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know. I’m sorry. Look, I’ll make a deal with you all right? Okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hmm.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: For every night that you’re asleep before I get home from work…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I will wake you up in a way that’s proved very popular in the past.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Now, if you need to stay late, I want to be supportive of that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi.
content.parenthetical: entering, holding a pair of Roller Blades

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look at you. Since when do you roller blade?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Since tomorrow. I met this really cute guy in the park and he like y’know, jogs, and blades, and swims, and so y’know we made a deal that’s he’s going to teach me all sorts of jock stuff.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And what are you going to do for him?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m going to let him.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Cool.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Morning.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Somebody got in late last night.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah well, I ran into Richard.
(They all gasp)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: When did this happen?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, um, around 8:02. We ah, talked for a little while, and then um, we went out for an innocent burger.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, there’s no such thing as an innocent burger.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, are you gonna see him again?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Tomorrow night.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, what are you doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, she spent the last six months getting over him, and now she’s celebrating that by going on a date with him.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s not a date, okay. I’m just gonna teach him how to make lasagne for some pot luck dinner he has.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, you might wanna make a little extra, y’know you’ll probably be hungry after the sex.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re not gonna have sex! Okay, nothing’s changed here. He still doesn’t want children and I still do, so that’s why we’re just gonna be friends.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Naked friends.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is watching TV.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you have any ice?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Check the freezer. If there’s none in there, then we’re probably out. Are you just getting in from work? It’s late.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I know. I had the greatest day though, I got to sit in on the meeting with the reps from Calvin Klien . I told my boss I liked this line of lingerie, she ordered a ton of it. How was your day?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I discovered I’m able to count all of my teeth using just my tongue.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hmm. (she opens the freezer) Umm, why do you have a copy of The Shining in your freezer?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I was reading it last night, and I got scared, so.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But ah, you’re safe from it if it’s in the freezer?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, safer. Y’know, I mean I never start reading The Shining , without making sure we’ve got plenty of room in the freezer, y’know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How often do you read it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Haven’t you ever read the same book over and over again?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, umm, I guess I read Little Women more than once. But I mean that’s a classic, what’s so great about The Shining ?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The question should be Rach, what is not so great about The Shining . Okay? And the answer would be: nothing. All right? This is like the scariest book ever. I bet it’s way better than that classic of yours.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Ah, well we’ll just see about that, okay. I will read The Shining , (she tries to take the book away from him but he doesn’t want to let it go) and you will read Little Women .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, you got it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah, now Rach, these ah, these little women.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How little are they? I mean, are they like scary little?

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Ross are there, Phoebe is entering with her date Robert.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, Chandler, Ross, this is Robert.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, hey.

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’ve have lipstick right here (points to her cheek). That’s okay, it’s mine, we just kissed.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So ah, isn’t a bit cold out for shorts?

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: Well, I’m from California.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Right, right. Sometimes you guys just burst into flames.
(Robert leans back on the arm of the chair and allows Chandler to see up his shorts and sees ‘little Robert.’ Chandler is horrified by this view.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m up! I’m up, I’ve gotten up now! Anybody ah, want anything?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’ll have coffee.

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: Yeah, me too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, make that three.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay Ross, why don’t you come with me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. (goes over to the counter) (to Chandler) What ah, what is the matter with you? What’s going on?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Robert’s coming out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, what do you mean, what? Is he gay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. He…he’s coming out of his shorts.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The man is showing brain.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you sure? (Chandler nods: Yes!) Hold on. (walks over behind the couch) I’m sorry you guys, that was a coffee and a…

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: Coffee.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: We could write it down for you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, that won’t be ah, that won’t be necessary (leans down and looks up Robert’s shorts, seeing Robert’s package.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wellll?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What do we do? What do we do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I suppose we just try to not look directly at it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Like an eclipse.
(Ross nods his head.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is teaching Richard how to make lasagne.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: So when people complement me on my cooking should I, what do I say?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You say ‘Thank you very much,’ and then you buy me something pretty. Come on, we’re gonna put are hands in this bowl, and we’re gonna start squishing the tomatoes.
(They both start squishing the tomatoes.)

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Ew, this feels very weird.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You touch people’s eyeballs every day and this feels weird.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Yeah, well, sure I touch them, but I spent years learning not to squish them. (Monica grabs his hand in the tomatoes.) That’s my hand.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oops.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Gotta keep squishing.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Tomatoes are squishing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.
(Richard squishes a little too hard and some lands on his shirt.)

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Op.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, gosh, you got some on your shirt.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hold on a second, just put a little club soda on it (does so) and it should umm, be…
(She is rubbing his chest and her voice trails off into silence, a long pause follows.)

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, you’ve got some on your pants.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I’ll just throw them out.

content.description: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler is watching Joey read Little Women, Ross is also there.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: These little women. Wow!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Your liking it, huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah! Amy just burned Jo’s manuscript. I don’t see how he could ever forgive her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm, Jo’s a girl, it’s short for Josephine.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But Jo’s got a crush on Laurie. (Ross nods his head) Oh. You mean it’s like a girl-girl thing? ‘Cause that is the one thing missing from The Shining .

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, actually Laurie’s a boy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No wonder Rachel had to read this so many times.
(Enter Phoebe and Robert)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! How’d the ah, basketball go?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay, I learned how to shoot a lay-up, a foul shot, and a twenty-three pointer.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You mean a three pointer?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I get more because I’m dainty.

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: So um, is there a phone here, I can check my messages?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, in the back. You want a quarter?

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: Oh, no thanks. I always carry one in my sock.
(He puts his leg up on the couch to get the quarter, once again exposing himself to Chandler and Ross. In horror, Chandler, slides over and leans against Joey on the couch.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you doing? (he pushes Chandler back to his side of the couch) Get back over on your side of the… (sees Robert in all his glory) Hello!! (to Robert) Hi, I’m Joey, we haven’t met.

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: Ah, good to meet you. Robert.
(Robert walks away and the guys all start laughing in front of Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What? (the guys keep laughing.) What? You guys, what is going on? You not like Robert? (the guys keep laughing.) Why are you laughing?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Calm down. There’s no reason to get testy.
(The guys start laughing harder.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys!! Come on!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry, I’m sorry, it just seems that Robert isn’t as concealed in the shorts area, as ah, one may have hoped.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What do you mean?

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: Hey. (sits down)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Robert, could you ah, ha, pass me those cookies?

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: Sure.
(He puts his leg up on the table to pass Joey the cookies, and Phoebe sees what the guys are laughing at, and gasps.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is talking to Richard on the phone.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, how’d the lasagne go over? (listens) Really?! Good. So you owe me three pretty things. (listens) Yeah, I’ve been thinking a lot about you too. (listens) I know. It’s hard this whole platonic thing. (listens) It’s a word!
(There’s a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I do think it’s better this way. (listens) Yeah, we’re being smart. (gets up to answer the door) (listens) Yes, I’m sure.(she opens the door and it’s Richard)

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: You really sure?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll call you back. (starts kissing him)

content.description: Monica’s bedroom, she’s in bed with Richard.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So we can be friends who sleep together.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Absolutely, this will just be something we do, like racquetball.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sounds smart and healthy to me. So um, just out of curiosity, um, do you currently have any other racquetball buddies?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Just your dad. (pause) Although that’s actually racquetball. You know I-I do have a blind date with my sister’s neighbour next Tuesday.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: You want me to cancel it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! (pushes him) No!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ‘Cause if you do that means you’d be cancelling it for me, and we’re just friends.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Exactly. (pushes her back)

content.description: Central Perk, Robert is picking up Phoebe for a date.

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey. Ooh! Don’t sit down!

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: You ready to go to the batting cage?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. And, first here’s a gift.

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: Oh! Wow! Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Stretchy pants! Why, those are the greatest things in the world! If I were you I would wear them every day, every day!

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: Jeez, thank you really that is so nice. But um, to be honest, I don’t think I can wear these, they’re so tight, I feel like I’m on display. I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s all right, that’s well, I figured… (they start to leave as Joey enters.)

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! (starts to laugh.) How’s it going?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Rach, how you doing with The Shining ?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Danny just went into room 217.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oooh, the next part’s the best, when that dead lady in the bathtub…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, no, meh-nah-nah-nah, come on you’re gonna ruin it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right I’ll talk in code. (to Ross and Chandler) Remember when the kid sees those two blanks in the hallway?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hmmm, that’s very cool.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, all blank, and no blank, make’s blank a blank blank. Oh no-no-no, no, the end when Jack almost kills them all with that blank, but then at last second they get away. Aww!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey! I can’t believe you just did that!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe she cracked your code!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, okay, Laurie proposes to Jo, and she says no, even though she’s still in love with him, and then he ends up marring Amy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Mine was by accident! All right, the boiler explodes and destroys the hotel, and kills the dad.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Eh. Beth dies.
(Joey recoils and gasps in horror.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Beth, Beth dies?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um-hmm.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is that true? If I keep reading is Beth gonna die?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, Beth doesn’t die, she doesn’t die. Does she Rachel?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey’s asking if you’ve just ruined the first book he’s ever loved that didn’t star Jack Nicholson?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. She doesn’t die.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Then why would you say that?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because, I wanted to hurt you.

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: Oh, there they are! I-I dropped my keys.
(He bends over to pick them up, right in front of Rachel, who then gets a free peep show.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my…

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: Got ‘em.

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is reading The Shining, as Monica enters.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sorry. I’m sorry.
content.parenthetical: screams and grabs a potato masher to defend herself

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You would not believe my day! I had to work two shifts, and then to top it off, I lost one of my fake boobs, (opens her coat revealing a large burn mark over her left breast.) in a grill fire.
(Rachel starts laughing.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you smiling at?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry, I was just thinking you’re day could still pick up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, right.
(She goes into her bedroom, and sees Richard who has covered the room in roses and has two glasses of wine and a rose between his lips.)

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I love this friend thing!

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe, Chandler, and Ross are there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Listen, Robert’s gonna be here any second so, will one of you just tell him?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Please, right now, no, every time I see him it’s like ‘Is it on the lose?’ ‘Is it watching me?’

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We can’t tell him, you can’t go up to a guy you barely know and talk about his… stuff.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He’s right, even if it’s to say something complementary. (He stops and thinks about what he just said.)

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: So are ready for the gym? They’ve got this new rock climbing wall, we can spot each other.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I can spot you from here.

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, listen Robert…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, don’t we have to…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, we got, um-hmm.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, I think you’re really, really great…

content.speaker: Robert
content.text: Oh God! Here we go again. Why does this keep happening to me? (spreads his legs) Is it something I’m putting out there? Is this my fault? Or am I just nuts?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I-I-I-I-I don’t know, I don’t know what to say.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: (to Robert) Hey buddy, this is a family place, put the mouse back in the house.
(Robert looks down and realises the problem.)

content.description: Richard’s bedroom, Monica has covered it in rose pedals and candles. We hear Richard come in to the apartment, and Monica frantically throws the rest of the pedals on the bed, and jumps onto the bed and puts a rose in her mouth, and bites a thorn.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ow!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Really?! Well, it’s just like everyone else’s apartment. It’s got rooms, walls, and ceilings.

content.speaker: Richard’s Date
content.text: Well, I just wanted to see where you lived. Now, give me the tour.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! Oh my God! (She frantically tries to clean up the bedroom as Richard starts the tour.)

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Ah well, this is the living room.

content.speaker: Richard’s Date
content.text: Impressive.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: All right. This is the kitchen.

content.speaker: Richard’s Date
content.text: Oh, that’s real pretty. Wait a minute, don’t I get to see the bedroom?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: The bedroom. Well it’s pretty much your typical… (opens the door as Monica hides under the covers, and quickly closes the door before his date can see the room.) bedroom.

content.speaker: Richard’s Date
content.text: We’re still on this side of the door.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Um-hmm.

content.speaker: Richard’s Date
content.text: Yeah, but I didn’t get to see it.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh shoot! Maybe next time. (yawns) Thanks for a lovely evening. (shows her out)
[Cut to into the bedroom, with Monica still hiding under the covers. Richard enters and sits down next to her.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So um, who was she?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh, (laughs) that was the blind date that I told you about, she called and switched it to today.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did you like her? And I’m just asking as a friend, because I am totally fine with this.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well, you seem fine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, y’know what, I’m not fine, I’m not. I mean how can I be fine, hearing you come in with her, she wants to see your bedroom… (pause) Y’know what, what if we’re friends who don’t see other people?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: You mean like exclusive friends?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why not?! I mean this has been the most amazing week. Would it be so terrible? Even if we were friends who lived together. Or, maybe someday friends who stood up in front of their other friends, and vowed to be friends forever.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Wow. Y’know we’re back where we were. Honey, I would love to do all that, but nothing’s changed.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s not true, you don’t have a moustache.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Okay, okay, one thing’s changed. But we still want different things and we know how this is gonna end.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what, I’ve got to walk out of here right now, ‘cause getting over you is the hardest thing that I have ever had to do. I don’t think I could do it again.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I know I couldn’t. So…
(Monica kisses him.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How ‘bout one last game of racquetball?
(They both kiss, and Richard picks her up and goes over to the bed and starts to lie down.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Watch the thorns!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Ow!!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey is entering, and he’s very dejected.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Beth is really, really sick.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Awwww.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Jo’s there, but I don’t think there’s anything she could do.
(Rachel hugs him)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you want to put the book in the freezer?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.
(Joey hands her the book and she puts it in the freezer.)
